**3. Cancellation of the Policy**
(a) This Policy may be cancelled at any time by Us giving fourteen (14) days' notice by registered mail to Your last known address, such cancellation shall become effective from the first day of the month following the date of such notice issued and in such event We will return a pro rata portion of the premium for the unexpired part of the Period of Insurance, provided no claim has been made under the Policy.
(b) The Policy may be cancelled by You by giving notice to Us in writing provided no claim has arisen during the Period of Insurance. You shall be entitled to a return of premium subject to the short period rates for the period the Policy has been in force as follows:
questions: How does the insurer's 14-day registered mail notice period for policy cancellation affect the effective cancellation date and the calculation of pro rata premium refunds when no claims have been made?
What are the conditions under which the policyholder can cancel the policy in writing, and how do short period rates apply to the premium refund if no claims have arisen?

In the event the insurer cancels the policy, how is the pro rata premium refund calculated relative to the first day of the month following the notice date, and what documentation or proof is required to confirm no claims have been made?
If the policyholder cancels the policy after a claim has been made during the Period of Insurance, how does this affect entitlement to any premium refund under the cancellation terms?

How do the cancellation provisions address the timing and method of notice delivery by both the insurer and the policyholder, and what are the implications if notice is not sent by registered mail or in writing respectively?
What happens to the premium refund if the insurer issues a cancellation notice but the policyholder disputes the last known address used for sending the registered mail?
How are short period rates determined and applied when the policyholder cancels the policy mid-term without any claims, and what impact does this have on the refund amount?

If the insurer cancels the policy and the notice is issued mid-month, why does the cancellation only become effective from the first day of the following month, and how does this affect coverage during the notice period?
Are there any exclusions or conditions that override the cancellation refund provisions if a claim has been made, and how does this interact with the general policy exclusions?
How does the policy define 'Period of Insurance' in relation to cancellation timing and premium refund calculations, especially when cancellation occurs close to the policy expiry date?
What documentation or proof must the policyholder provide to demonstrate that no claim has arisen during the Period of Insurance when requesting cancellation and a premium refund?

In cases where the policyholder cancels the policy and the short period rates apply, how are these rates communicated or calculated, and do they vary based on the length of time the policy was in force?
If the insurer cancels the policy and returns a pro rata premium, how is the unexpired portion of the Period of Insurance calculated when the policy has variable start and end dates?
How do the cancellation provisions handle situations where the policyholder has made a claim after the insurer has sent a cancellation notice but before the cancellation becomes effective?
What are the implications for coverage and premium refund if the policyholder sends a cancellation notice but it is received after the insurer has already issued a cancellation notice?
How does the policy address cancellation and premium refunds in the event of overlapping notices from both insurer and policyholder within the same Period of Insurance?
Are there any specific exclusions or conditions that prevent the insurer from cancelling the policy or returning premium under certain circumstances, despite the 14-day notice provision?
How does the cancellation clause interact with any automatic extensions or grace periods that may be part of the policy, particularly regarding premium refunds and coverage continuity?
What is the impact on premium refunds if the policyholder cancels the policy shortly before the policy expiry date, considering the application of short period rates?
How does the policy ensure fairness in premium refunds when cancellation occurs, considering potential delays in notice delivery and the timing of claims relative to cancellation?
